project_abstract.cdata: The objective of the Railway Rehabilitation Project is to support and deepen the restructuring process which Societatea Nationala a Cailor Ferate Romane (SNCFR), the Romanian national railways, and the government have initiated. The project supports a set of policy measures that are embodied in the new Railway Law, the Restructuring Action Plan (RAP), and the performance contract between SNCFR and the government. The project will only finance investments, which would be required even under pessimistic traffic assumptions and would be in line with the restructuring objectives. They are: 1) track renewal and maintenance on priority routes; 2) integrated railway information system (IRIS); 3) telecommunications and signalling; 4) environmental improvement; 5) traction and depots improvements; 6) rehabilitation of passenger coaches and freight wagons; and 7) technical services.
